analysis: The majority of reviews failed to adhere to the strict '2 Positive / 1 Negative' sentiment structure. A significant number of reviews were overwhelmingly negative, listing 3 or more negative points without any positives (e.g., ID 3, 4, 14, 15). Others attempted a mix but failed the exact count, often providing 2 Positives and 2 Negatives (ID 23, 40) or just a single general positive grouping followed by multiple complaints. Only four reviews (ID 10, 11, 12, 47) successfully isolated exactly two distinct positive attributes and one negative attribute.

The vast majority of reviews failed to adhere to the strict '2 Positive / 1 Negative' structure. Most reviews (e.g., ID 6, 13, 27) were overwhelmingly one-sided, offering either a list of purely positive traits (Graphics, Gameplay, Sound) or purely negative complaints without balancing points. Several reviews (e.g., ID 1, 2, 45) attempted to introduce a point at the end but were cut off due to length limits, resulting in incomplete arguments. Only 3 reviews (ID 38, 39, 44) successfully isolated two distinct positive attributes and one clear negative attribute.
